ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: This was the second busiest class I had this semester, mostly due to the readings. It was maybe approximately 8 hours outside of class.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This was a wonderful class. The readings were highly relevant, diverse, and interesting. Our in-depth discussions were something I looked forward to each week. Also the guest speakers were thoughtfully chosen and all excellent.
This has been one of my favorite courses I have taken at Yale. I especially enjoyed the variety of topics and readings covered. I also liked having the opportunity to lead a class discussion.
I am very happy I was able to take this course in my first semester. The small class size and discussions greatly matured my level of understanding of the literature and the health of older adults.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Becca Levy  Becca is a wonderful instructor. She cares deeply about the success of each student and it shows. She provided each of us with helpful and insightful feedback on our final research proposals, and she helped us to examine the assigned literature in a thought-provoking, interesting way. I loved having her as an instructor!
Instructor: Becca Levy  Dr. Levy is wonderful. She is very approachable and offers great feedback.
Instructor: Becca Levy  Becca was excellent at facilitating the discussion. She provided great feedback.
Instructor: Becca Levy  She did not do much teaching herself; most of the course involved guest lecturers. Overall, she is nice and knowledgeable about the topic.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course to other students, even those who think they are not interested in aging. It provides you with invaluable perspectives that I don't think you can get from other courses. I am so happy this course was able to run this semester!
This course covers very important and relevant topics in public health. I would definitely recommend it!
I would recommend it because there aren't many aging classes available and it does offer some good information.
